With 6 alive, it takes 4 to lynch. Deadline is in (expired on 2014-02-13 20:13:42) from now.

Sample Role PM

At least one of you will receive this role pm:

Welcome [Player] to Mini 1532! You are a Vanilla Townie!

Abilities

- You have your voice and your vote. Use them wisely.

Win Condition

- You win when all threats to the town are eliminated


Game Events

Day one begins!

RULES
(shamelessly stolen from GuyInFreezer)

General Rules:

1. Site-wide rules always apply here.

2. If you have a question for me, you can always PM me. If you need to talk to me in thread, please bold your question and begin with @mod so I can locate it better.

3. You may not use hidden or encrypted text.

4. If you have a power to edit/delete your post, don't do it. If you hydra/alt slip, or have a tag failure, ask me to correct it. Otherwise it will be left.

5. Play nice. I really don't mind bad language, but keep it reasonable. Players will be warned if necessary.

6. Do not EVER discuss ongoing games in this thread nor discuss this game elsewhere.

7. Do not quote ANYTHING that the moderator sends you. Doing so will result in an instant modkill.

8. Red is my color. Don't use it. Any other colours are fine.

9. Don't attempt to impersonate the mod. At all.

10. If you break these rules, I have full rights to punish you at my will. This can range from simple warning to modkill/force-replace.

11. If I feel like it, I always have a full right to add/modify the rules. If I do, I will fully explain the reason behind such action.

12. Most importantly, have fun!

Voting and Lynching:

1. You vote by either using bold tag (vote: Mac) or using vote tags (VOTE: Mac.)

2. Unvoting is not required. Votes MUST use the above formatting or they will not be counted. Abbreviations of names are fine as long as they are understandable. Don't try to trick me either.

3. A lynch occurs when half of players + 1 vote the same person. Once a lynch happens, the game will enter the twilight period until the game is locked. Discussion may continue at this point until the thread is locked.

4. The majority MUST be reached before the deadline expires, or else a no-lynch will occur.

5. Players are allowed ONE "bah" post after being nightkilled. This MUST NOT contain any information with regards to the game, or the player will most likely be warned for breaking site rules.

Activity and Deadline:

1. Deadline for each day is 14 days, and deadline for each night is 48 hours.

2. If you're on V/LA, please tell me beforehand by either posting it in thread or PM to me.

3. If you don't post here for 48 real hours, I will prod you. Failure to receive prod within 24 hours or receiving 3+ prods in game will cause force-replacement.

4. If you do not submit a night action, it will count as No Action.

5. If I have to extend deadline, I will. If I do, I will post it on thread.

Role PMs are in the process of going out. Game will start when 10/13 have confirmed!

Role PMs are out! Players have (expired on 2013-12-19 08:44:46) to confirm, or else replacements will be found.

With 10/13 confirmed, day one can begin! Players who have not confirmed have (expired on 2013-12-19 08:47:08) to do so or face replacement.

Aaaand we're into a meta discussion on page two. Wonderful. I would say that Bauss could just sign my name to posts to destroy that meta read, but let's be honest: We can all figure out which one it is by whether or not the conversation is based in reality (Rank) or whargarbl (Bauss).

Rank

Oh man, you couldn't be more wrong.

But I screwed up this meta read by jumping too quickly onto you. I should have waited it out more, but I got so damned excited.

I did find a (weak, mind you) parallel. And I found it was more than enough for voting you. It doesn't matter how many words were in that post or how many weren't. There's intent. Want to know one of my few meta reads on you so far? You avoid getting on a wagon early game. You did so last game, you're doing so now. Guess what your first post was in that other game. Hint: it's not a wagon vote. I wanted to wait it out more, see what votes you were going to place, but I got too excited.

And then pie comes in to play and posts that list, which only cemented my initial read of you. Which might have been swayed to a town read, had your reaction not been what it was. But, wait! There's more:

Secondly, as soon as a wagon (even the slightest hint of) starts while you're on it, you get off the wagon. Take a guess when you took your vote off of SoS (hint: after pie voted her). Thirdly, you're twisting my words again. When we went into full on debate in the other game, that's all you did. I remember the scumslip you claimed to have seen. You voluntarily twist words:

"Regardless of my meta read making sense or being true or not, I don't like his reaction one bit." ~ myself

This in no way means I don't stand behind that meta read. No matter how hard you try to twist it. It means that I don't like your reaction to the read, regardless of the read being right or not (objectively, subjectively I think it's correct). Want to know why this leaves a bad taste in my mouth? I don't want to be posting ICE disclaimers again. Want to know why I posted those? Because you twisted my words at every turn to get me incriminated.

I'm still not sure you're scum because of those parallels, as the meta might be wrong, after all it's still one game, but your posts scream your scumplay so loudly I can't ignore it. I needed more time and information but I jumped the gun way too early because your two-three posts really fit the play and it got me excited that I found ICEscum. But I'm not liking your play one bit: if you're so certain that my meta read of you on that one post is wrong, you shouldn't react this defensive. A meta read is a tool to read someone, a minor tool, not something that defines everything. I could have been swayed had you replied differently. You are way too hard on the defense over something so "trivial" (for the lack of a better English word). The only thing I can think that warrants you being this defensive is that you are scum.


Cards are on the table, way too soon for my liking (my own fault) and that meta has become useless for the future


Even if meta reads are useless and boring this early, I still don't like your play. I'm just too excited about it to let it go. (sorry guys)

Given that there is no sign of any other power role claims*, it is extremely unlikely that TV is an SK from a balance point of view.

We know that there is a third mafia left, regardless of TV's alignment. If TV were an SK, this would be the setup: 2 Mafia Goons + 1 Mafia Unknown Role vs 1 Serial Killer vs Town Two-shot Cop + Town Doctor. If you took the SK out of that setup, it would be arguably scumsided even if the third mafia role is a good. Including an SK, the town is really underpowered, with their only investigative role fairly limited and its only protection twice as likely to get killed by someone who has good reason to want it dead. For TV to be an SK, we have to be in that situation, and I have a hard time seeing the setup being approved for balance.

On the other hand, if TV is town, then the setup is: 2 Mafia Goons + 1 Unknown Role (probably bulletproof but possibly investigation-immune) vs Town Two-shot Cop + Town Doctor + Town X-Shot Vig. That's a much more reasonable setup, and so many degrees more likely than the SK variation that I would be astonished if TV were an SK.

Frog, different strategies work well for different people. I, for one, am pretty mediocre at reading a player's posts and determining alignment from them. I'm also not very good at determining someone's alignment by getting in to a heated back and forward with them (generally when I do that it is because I'm already fairly certain of their guilt and looking to get other votes on them).

What I am very good at is assessing the situation. I look at how wagons formed, how they fell apart, how easily they formed, and determine who is scum based on that. If a player is scummy as hell, gets run up to L-1 or L-2 then another player does something sort of scummy and gets lynched, there's a good chance the first wagon was scum. Competing wagons are rarely all on town. Scum are very difficult to lynch, whereas bad townie is very easy to lynch. Too little resistance on your wagon likely means you're wrong, whereas too much resistance that makes no sense likely means you're right.

Also some people prefer town hunting, and I do this too sometimes. Try finding a block of players that, for the purposes of that day, will not be lynched because of the fact that they are probably town. With the rest of the pool being much smaller, you have a much higher chance of finding scum.

Basically, if something isn't working out for you try a different mindset. If you've been avoiding rereads, give them a try. If you've only been looking at players in ISO, try looking at players within context (i love using multiple tabs). If you tend to only go through the gist of things, try reading players carefully in ISO. If you find yourself with too much confirmation bias, question your own reads. Look at possibilities where you might be wrong. Things like that.
